name: interculture
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a set of relationships and ways of behaving that develop in groups whose members come from different cultures: She describes the world of Europe and North America as "an increasingly interconnected oceanic inter-culture". Slobin distinguishes three types of inter-culture.
More examplesFewer examplesAn everyday, evolving interculture exists in places like this.The paper argues for a more nuanced understanding of contemporary moves towards interculture in Australian environmental education practice. Historians have argued that a transatlantic interculture developed within a complex and intensifying system of trade and migration.
